result.execSummary:
The defendant Rebecca Lynn Scholze was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant to pay fine, costs and DNA surcharge within 60 days (3/11/16) or request a payment plan through the Dodge County Clerk of Courts office within said time.
Defendant shall submit a DNA sample and surcharge.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
15CM305 & 15CM335: Defendant Craig D. Scholze and Rebecca Scholze in court with attorney Jacquelyn Wolter.  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court heard on recomm.; Court reviews GPQPA& WOR; Court reviews charge/penalties in 15CM335; Def. pleads NC to Poss. of DP; stip. to facts; Court finds plea made FV&I and finds Def. in 15CM335 guilty of Poss. of DP; Court imposes sentence; Court reviews charge in 15CM305 of Poss. of THC in Count 1; Def. pleads NC; stip. to facts; Court finds plea made FV&I and finds Def. guilty in 15CM305 of Poss. of THC w/Count 2 D&RI; Court imposes sentence

15CM335: Poss. of DP
* $100 F+C = $379.00 within 60 days
* $200 DNA surcharge and sample

15CM305: Poss. of THC
* $100 F+C = $473.50 within 60 days
* $200 DNA surcharge and sample
of Intent to Present Testimony by Videoconferencing

Attorney Jacquelyn Wolter appeared. Def. FTA for Return Date; Atty. Wolter heard on Def.'s FTA; State appears by James Sempf; Atty. Wolter heard - Court authorizes warrant - stayed to JT date; bond cont.

Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.

Defendant Rebecca Lynn Scholze in court with attorney Jacquelyn Wolter.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin by intern Kevin Schmidt.  Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges and penalties. Court finds probable cause. RD & JT set. Court sets $500 bond with conditions:  Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.  Return date scheduled for November 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for December 8, 2015 at 08:15 am.
